Posts.Content: Hi, the day has finally arrived and I get results of test from USA today I hope. Then guessing decisions made re 6 months chemo then radiotherapy then hormone treatment or no chemo and just the other two.  The crazy thing is I have got myself in quite a state worrying about it. You hear such scary things about chemo . I have resisted the temptation to google but I know by sharing my fears someone will help calm me.  Up to now I have been so lucky. A routine mammogram picked up the lump no one could feel. The lumpectomy went well and the sentinel node was clear. Everyone has been so kind and I'm so grateful. Just feeling bit vulnerable this am after a long night.  Love and positive vibes to everyone on this amazing site. X
Posts.Title: Scared about today

Posts.Content: Loving the pics. Made me smile. Thank you.  Not a lot else to smile about though as meeting with oncologist a bit of a waste of time. Results not back from USA even though had surgery 11th February. Get the impression also decision could be passed back to me. What a decision. How can I make it? Didn't really follow a lot of what she said but think she thinks maybe chemo not appropriate for me. Is it worth putting body through it when maybe doesn't alter stats too much. 2%? And even with chemo could still come back. Radiotherapy and letrozole maybe my best bet to keep it away.  Am totally confused.
Posts.Title: Scared about today

Posts.Content: Thank you to everyone who has replied. It certainly helps to hear from you all.  Will let you know. X
Posts.Title: Scared about today

Posts.Content: Thank you.
Posts.Title: Scared about today

Posts.Content: Hi, hope you don't mind me asking. Did they recommend you had chemo? I am still waiting for my results! Has been nearly 7 weeks since op. Have also  been led to believe if comes back intermediate risk it will be my decision regarding chemo.
Posts.Title: THE WAITING !!!

Posts.Content: Operation tomorrow and getting bit nervous now  How soon after lumpectomy and sentinel node removal do I start doing the exercises?  Do I do them daily or morning and night?  Thanks
Posts.Title: Exercises

Posts.Content: Good morning, sending my best wishes and love to everyone on this amazing site. A beautiful sunny day where I live so always gives me a lift. Hope the sun is shining for you too. A question I hope someone can answer. Am due to start a 15 day course of radiotherapy soon and am very keen to get hold of some R1 and R2 gel and lotion as I have read some great reviews. Any ideas as to how I can purchase some as I have a horrible feeling my GP will not prescribe it.  Thanks in anticipation of any help.  Big hugs.
Posts.Title: R1 and R2

Posts.Content: Hi, am totally new to this as only found out last week that I have breast cancer. Got lumpectomy and sentinel node removal on Thursday. Then radiotherapy I think. Bit surreal at moment as diagnosis was complete shock. Mammogram picked up problem and even consultant can't feel lump. Is that good or bad? Anyone know? Thanks.
Posts.Title: New diagnosis

Posts.Content: Thank you. Helps a lot.
Posts.Title: Discomfort increasing

Posts.Content: Hi, had a lumpectomy and sentinel node removal last Thursday and wounds seem  to be healing as they should. Have been doing the exercises and trying to take a short walk each day. The pain was kept under control with paracetamol and iboprofen. Today it seems like the pain is a little worse. Is this normal? Don't like to ring the bcn with every question so thought I'd ask here.  This site is amazing and I find it so inspirational and helpful. Thank you to all who respond and sending my love and positive vibes to everyone.
Posts.Title: Discomfort increasing

Posts.Content: Hey Loolyboo, thanks so much for your reply. I have taken more tablets but what you said made so much sense.  Good luck when you start your chemo.  My follow up appointment next week. Already nervous about it but trying to stay calm and remain positive. I need to know what next then I can try and deal with it the best I can.  Lots of love. X

Posts.Title: Discomfort increasing

Posts.Content: Thank you. Helps a lot.
Posts.Title: Discomfort increasing

Posts.Content: Congratulations to you both and have a great day. X
Posts.Title: Celebration today ...

Posts.Content: Hi, hope you get your date soon. The waiting, for me, is most definitely the hardest thing.  I had a lumpectomy and sentinel node removal nearly 6 weeks ago. I came home the same day and took paracetamol every 2 hours and also iboprofen every few hours. I don't know if I was lucky but it was not as bad as I'd feared. I found sleeping with my arm resting on a little cushion helped.  I started my exercises gently the next day and went a little walk in the sunshine. If you take it steady I'm sure you'd be ok to travel on a bus. Be great if someone could be with you though.  Good luck. Take care. X
Posts.Title: Bus home after surgery?

Posts.Content: Thank you.
Posts.Title: Delay in treatment

Posts.Content: Hi, because I am still waiting for results of oncotype dx tests 5 weeks after surgery I am starting to panic that the delay to starting treatment will increase the chances of the cancer that was removed coming back. Am I irrational? I had been feeling so positive and now I'm just worrying all the time. And maybe overthinking things.  I need to start either chemo or radiotherapy and letrozole as soon as possible because I am doing nothing but worry at the moment.  Doesn't help that my care is also being transferred as I moved to a different authority a week before diagnosis.  Can cancer return in a matter of weeks?  Thanks .
Posts.Title: Delay in treatment

Posts.Content: Thanks to everyone who replied. Helped a lot. Have decided to use it and will keep you informed how I get on.  Hope everyone is doing ok. Sending positive vibes and love.
Posts.Title: Confusion over R1 and R2

Posts.Content: Good morning, hope this finds everyone doing ok and keeping warm. Freezing where I live.  My GP would not prescribe R1 and R2 without a letter from the hospital and the Oncologist has not returned my calls so guessing it's a no.  However been able to get hold of them from an independent pharmacy which is reassuring. Has anyone else had this experience? Would you use them even though not directed by your care team? The reviews I've read seem to rave about their use. But then I wonder why my oncologist will not recommend that they are prescribed for me.  Thanks. Love and positive vibes to all.
Posts.Title: Confusion over R1 and R2

Posts.Content: Hi, got results today and tumour gone and node clear so brilliant that I don't need more surgery.  However got quite a shock when possible chemo mentioned. Awaiting results from analysis in the USA??? Am sure I read somewhere on this site that they were awaiting the results of a similar thing. Why chemo if cancer gone? I will do whatever is recommended to get well but was just expecting radiotherapy. It may turn out to be chemo then radiotherapy then hormone treatment.  As ever it's the unknown that scares me and if my previous visits to this site are anything to go by I am convinced someone will have already been through this.  Thanks in advance and love and positive vibes to everyone. Xx
Posts.Title: Possible chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi, the wait will be difficult but you will get through it.  I had to wait for results of biopsies but deep down I think I knew the results before I went. Everyone was so kind when they broke the news.  I'd try and keep busy. I literally did something each day even if it was just wandering round the shops or walking in woods with friends.  I found it hard to talk but this site was so helpful. I read so many inspiring posts and asked many questions.  I had my lumpectomy and sentinel node removal on Thursday and now await the results in a week and a half. Keeping all crossed. The plan is radiotherapy at the moment but not sure yet. That's the problem isn't it? The loss of control and total uncertainty.  Be strong. Try and keep busy and remember many many people care and will be rooting for you.  Take care. X
Posts.Title: Awaiting results of biopsy

Posts.Content: Thank you. I'll be enjoying a glass later I'm sure.  Love and positive vibes sent your way. X
Posts.Title: Red wine

Posts.Content: Any advice re having a glass of red wine?   Had lumpectomy and node removal 2 weeks ago and luckily I don't have to have anymore surgery. Am waiting to see what comes next and it will either be chemotherapy then radiotherapy and hormone treatment or no chemo and just the other 2. Guessing it'll be another week or so before I find out.  Life has been really stressful lately and I really fancy a small glass of wine with my tea. Any advice would be welcome. Read so much conflicting advice on the Internet and just confuses me.  Thanks in advance and love and positive vibes to everyone. Xx
Posts.Title: Red wine
